Country Name: Data from database: World Development Indicators

Series Code: Number of adults (ages 15-49) newly infected with HIV.
column8: Despite the existence of effective medications and treatment, HIV/AIDS is still a leading cause of death and public health threat in the world.  Low and middle income countries continue to bear a disproportionate share of the global burden of HIV/AIDS. The incidence rate provides a measure of progress toward preventing onward transmission of HIV. Also, the identification of newly infected persons will allow for interventions to reduce the risk of HIV transmission.
column9: This indicator is related to Sustainable Development Goal 3.3.1 [https://unstats.un.org/sdgs/metadata/].
